purpleculture_pinyin:
quán
authority; power; right; (literary) to weigh; expedient; temporary; surname Quan
орган власти; мощность; верно; (литературный) взвесить; целесообразно; временный; фамилия Цюань
rtega_mnemonic:
権権RS
权权		權power, right, authority
  • modf. 權 → 権; men sitting high 雚 on top of a tree 木: they have a commanding view and thus instate power and authority
  • ⓢ hand 又 ripping out a tree 木: power
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 权)
Pictophonetic: 雚 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
權利 [ quán lì ]: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth); (classical) power and wealth
權力 [ quán lì ]: power; authority
權益 [ quán yì ]: rights; interests; rights and benefits
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 雚 [ guàn ] heron; small cup
heisig_chinese_memo: Some storks live in trees and don't mess around with deliveries so that the government has no authority over them.
Ru_trainchinese:
quán: (сущ/нареч) право; сила, власть; временно, пока
quán: (графема) (книжн.) гирька безмена; взвешивать; необходимость; выгодное положение
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Some women give authority to men with crotches that look like trees
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wood " to "雚" sound. " Quan " is the name of the tree. "Er Ya. Shi Mu": "Quan, Huang Ying." "Shuo Wen": "Quan, Huang Huamu. Congmu, Yu Sheng." But this usage is not seen in ancient books. " Quan " is often used in its pseudonym to mean a weight, that is, a metal hammer used to balance the scale and measure the weight of objects, which is equivalent to later weights. "Guang Ya. Shiqi: "The hammer is the right." Such as "The Analects. "Zihan": "Can be with standing, but not with power." Zhu Xi's collection of notes: "Power, weighing hammers. So the one who knows the weight and the weight is also called the thing." "Book of Rites. "Da Chuan": "Establish power, measure, measure, examine the article, correct the novel, easy to understand." Kong Yingda Shu: "Power is called the hammer."

" Quan " also refers to scales, that is, an instrument for measuring the weight of objects. Such as "The Analects. "Yao Yue": "Respect power and measure, review laws, revise and abolish officials, and act in all directions." He Yan's collection of explanations: "Power, name." "Han Shu. "Lv Li Zhi 1": "The right person, Zhu, Liang, Jin, Jun, Shi Ye, so it is said that things are flat, knowing the weight."

" Quan " as a verb indicates measurement. Such as "Mandarin. "Zhou Yu": "The ancients, natural disasters brought hostility, so the amount of money, the weight of the weight, in order to revitalize and save the people." Wei Zhao's note: "Power, name." "Mencius. "Liang Hui Wang": "Power, then know the severity; degree, then know the long know."

The extension of " right " means measurement and comparison. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Be cautious about the situation: "The weight is heavy, the size is judged, and more feudal institutions are established to facilitate the situation." "Huainanzi. Synopsis: "If Liu's book is to observe the images of the world, to understand the theory of ancient and modern, the power and the system are established, and the form is suitable."

" Quan " means balance and average. Such as "Zhou Li. Kao Gong Ji. "The Bowman": "The bow of nine harmony, horns and power." Zheng Xuan's note: "Power, Ping Ye." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi's "Book of the Upper Emperor": "The ancients established the country, so that the internal and external phases of the system, the weight of the power."

" Power " also means power. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-Three Years of Xianggong": "Why are you afraid of not only benefiting power, but also holding the people's authority?" "Warring States. "Qin Cesan": "Those who are good for the country consolidate their prestige internally, but value their power externally."

" Quan " means flexibility and contingency. In ancient books, it is opposed to " jing " (unchanging truth) and " chang ". "Shuowen": "One said: Abnormal." Zhu Junsheng "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "Power is the right of contingency." Such as "Gongyang Zhuan. The Eleventh Year of Huan Gong: "Where is the power? The power is against the classics, and then there is the good." "Mencius. "Li Lou Shang": "Whether men and women give or receive marriage, the courtesy is also; the sister-in-law, the one who helps the hand, the power is also." Zhao Qi's note: "The power is good, on the contrary.

" Power " means strategy and strategy. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. Xuangong Twelve Years": "Military, right yaw, left chasing, no care for the front, middle power, stamina." Du pre-note: "The Chinese army makes plans, and then the elite soldiers are the temple." "Xunzi. "Wang Hegemony": "So those who use the country will stand by righteousness and be king, trust and hegemony, and power will die."

" Quan " also means temporary office. "Old Tang Book. "Gao Zu Ji": "Sima Yu Wenshi, General Tiance's Mansion, Quanjian School Servant." "Song History. "Li Gang Chuan": "According to the official to supervise the Yushi, and serve as the Yushi in the Palace of Power."

" Quan " can be used as an adverb, meaning for the time being. Such as "Han Shu. "Wang Mang Chuan 1": "Zhou Gongquan live in the photo, then Zhou Daocheng, and the royal family will be safe; not in the photo, fear that the Zhou team will lose the fate." "Selected Works. Zuo Taichong's "Wei Du Fu": "Quan holiday is more prosperous than Chaohua." Li Shan's note: "Quan, still surviving."
humanum_short_description_en: From " wood " to "雚" sound. " Quan " is the name of a tree, but this usage is not seen in ancient books. " Quan " is often used in its pseudonym to mean a weight, that is, a metal hammer used to balance the scale and measure the weight of objects, which is equivalent to later weights.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「雚」聲。「權」是樹木名。《爾雅．釋木》：「權，黃英。」《說文》：「權，黃華木。从木，雚聲。」但古書中不見此用法。「權」多用其假借義，表示秤錘，即用來使秤平衡、量度物件重量的金屬錘，相當於後來的砝碼。《廣雅．釋器》：「錘謂之權。」如《論語．子罕》：「可與立，未可與權。」朱熹集注：「權，秤錘也。所以稱物而知輕重者也。」《禮記．大傳》：「立權、度、量，考文章，改正朔，易服色。」孔穎達疏：「權，謂稱錘。」

　　「權」也泛指秤，即量度物體重量的器具。如《論語．堯曰》：「謹權量，審法度，脩廢官，四方之政行焉。」何晏集解：「權，稱也。」《漢書．律曆志上》：「權者，銖、兩、斤、鈞、石也，所以稱物平施，知輕重也。」

　　「權」作動詞表示量度。如《國語．周語》：「古者，天災降戾，於是乎量資幣，權輕重，以振救民。」韋昭注：「權，稱也。」《孟子．梁惠王上》：「權，然後知輕重；度，然後知長知。」

　　「權」引申表示衡量、比較。如《呂氏春秋．慎勢》：「權輕重，審大小，多建封所以便其勢也。」《淮南子．要略》：「若劉氏之書，觀天地之象，通古今之論，權事而立制，度形而施宜。」

　　「權」表示平衡、平均。如《周禮．考工記．弓人》：「九和之弓，角與幹權。」鄭玄注：「權，平也。」北宋蘇軾〈上皇帝書〉：「古者建國，使內外相制，輕重相權。」

　　「權」也表示權力。如《左傳．襄公二十三年》：「既有利權，又執民柄，將何懼焉？」《戰國策．秦策三》：「善為國者，內固其威，而外重其權。」

　　「權」表示變通、權變，在古書中與「經」（不變的道理）、「常」相對。《說文》：「一曰：反常。」朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「權，又為權變之權。」如《公羊傳．桓公十一年》：「權者何？權者反於經，然後有善者也。」《孟子．離婁上》：「男女授受不親，禮也；嫂溺，援之以手者，權也。」趙岐注：「權者，反經而善也。」

　　「權」表示謀略、權謀。如《左傳．宣公十二年》：「軍行，右轅，左追蓐，前茅慮無，中權，後勁。」杜預注：「中軍制謀，後以精兵為殿。」《荀子．王霸》：「故用國者，義立而王，信立而霸，權謀立而亡。」

　　「權」還表示暫代官職。《舊唐書．高祖紀》：「天策上將府司馬宇文士及，權檢校侍中。」《宋史．李綱傳》：「積官至監察御史，兼權殿中侍御史。」

　　「權」可作副詞，表示暫且。如《漢書．王莽傳上》：「周公權而居攝，則周道成，王室安；不居攝，則恐周隊失天命。」《文選．左太沖〈魏都賦〉》：「權假日以餘榮，比朝華而菴藹。」李善注：「權，猶苟且也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「雚」聲。「權」是樹木名，但古書中不見此用法。「權」多用其假借義，表示秤錘，即用來使秤平衡、量度物件重量的金屬錘，相當於後來的砝碼。

權 (Simplified: 权)
Pinyin: quán
English Definition: authority; power; right; (literary) to weigh; expedient; temporary; surname Quan
Total strokes: 22; Radical: 木
Pictophonetic: 雚 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 雚 [ guàn ] heron; small cup
Example Words:
權利 [ quán lì ]: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth); (classical) power and wealth
權力 [ quán lì ]: power; authority
權益 [ quán yì ]: rights; interests; rights and benefits
More: 權* | *權 | *權*

quan2
HSK 4: 全,泉
HSK 5: 權,权,拳
権権RS
权权 		權 power, right, authority
  • modf. 權 → 権; men sitting high 雚 on top of a tree 木: they have a commanding view and thus instate power and authority
  • ⓢ hand 又 ripping out a tree 木: power
(Simplified: 权)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 雚 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 雚 [ guàn ] heron; small cup
①職責範圍內支配和指揮的力量：政權。權力。權威。權貴。權柄。權勢。生殺予奪之權。
②有利的形勢：主動權。
③變通，不依常規：權變。權謀(隨機應變的計謀)。權術。智必知權。
④暫且，姑且：權且。
⑤秤錘：權衡。
⑥衡量，估計：權其輕重。
⑦姓氏。
權利 [ quán lì ]: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth); (classical) power and wealth
權力 [ quán lì ]: power; authority
權益 [ quán yì ]: rights; interests; rights and benefits
(Simplified: 权)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 雚 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 5
Chinese: Some storks live in trees and don't mess around with deliveries so that the government has no authority over them.
Meaning: authority
Hanzi: 权
Story: Some women give authority to men with crotches that look like trees
Kind: traditional
